meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be repaired.
meanings.sent1: The repairability of the toy made it a good purchase for parents.
meanings.sent2: The repairability of the phone was a key factor in my decision to buy it.
meanings.sent3: The repairability of the broken chair became a family joke as we tried to fix it.
meanings.sent4: Her repairability was like a superhero power, fixing everything in her path.
meanings.sent5: The repairability of the old car was so impressive that it seemed almost magical.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily fixed or restored.
meanings.sent1: I appreciate the repairability of this watch; it's so convenient.
meanings.sent2: The repairability of the laptop saved me a lot of money on repairs.
meanings.sent3: The repairability of the leaky faucet made it the easiest chore of the day.
meanings.sent4: His repairability shone through as he effortlessly fixed the broken door.
meanings.sent5: The repairability of the old clock was a testament to its quality craftsmanship.
